title: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)
content: XSS vulnerabilities occur when applications include untrusted data in a web page without proper validation or escaping, allowing attackers to execute scripts in a user's browser.

title: Security Misconfiguration
content: Security misconfiguration occurs when security settings are defined, implemented, and maintained improperly, making systems vulnerable to attacks.

title: Sensitive Data Exposure
content: Sensitive data exposure occurs when applications do not adequately protect sensitive information such as financial or healthcare data, potentially leading to unauthorized access and data breaches.

title: Broken Access Control
content: Broken access control occurs when restrictions on authenticated users are not properly enforced, allowing attackers to act outside of their intended permissions.

title: Broken Authentication
content: Broken authentication vulnerabilities occur when application functions related to authentication and session management are implemented incorrectly, allowing attackers to compromise passwords, keys, or session tokens.

title: XML External Entities (XXE)
content: XXE vulnerabilities arise when XML parsers process external entities within XML documents, which can lead to data exposure, denial of service, or server-side request forgery attacks.

title: Insecure Deserialization
content: Insecure deserialization vulnerabilities arise when untrusted data is used to abuse the logic of an application, escalate privileges, or execute arbitrary code.

title: Injection Vulnerability
content: Injection vulnerabilities occur when untrusted data is sent to an interpreter as part of a command or query. Attackers can exploit these flaws to execute unintended commands or access unauthorized data.

title: Using Components with Known Vulnerabilities
content: This vulnerability occurs when applications use third-party components with known security flaws, potentially allowing attackers to exploit these weaknesses.

title: Insufficient Logging and Monitoring
content: This issue arises when logging and monitoring are inadequate, allowing attackers to further exploit systems, maintain persistence, and pivot to other systems without detection.
